content.description: You are asked to identify rhythms. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the relevant choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following represents the rhythm sounded?

choices.label: The figure presents a staff with a treble clef. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are two measures. The rhythm in measure one is: sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth with a tie to a eighth, sixteenth and sixteenth note. The pitches are: G 4, A 4, B 4 tied to B 4, A 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: half note. The pitch is F sharp 4.

The figure presents a treble staff. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are two measures. The rhythm in measure one is: eighth note, sixteenth note, sixteenth note with a tie to sixteenth note, sixteenth note and eighth note. The pitches are: G 4, A 4, B 4 tied to B 4, A 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: half note. The pitch is F sharp 4.

The figure presents a treble staff. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are two measures. The rhythm in measure one is: eighth note, sixteenth note, sixteenth note with a tie to eighth note, sixteenth note and sixteenth note. The pitches are: G 4, A 4, B 4 tied to B 4, A 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: half note. The pitch is F sharp 4.

The figure presents a treble staff. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are two measures. The rhythm in measure one is: sixteenth note, sixteenth note, eighth note with a tie to sixteenth note, sixteenth note and eighth note. The pitches are: G 4, A 4, B 4 tied to B 4, A 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: half note. The pitch is F sharp 4.

content.answer: The figure presents a treble staff. There is no key signature. The time signature is of two four time. There are two measures. The rhythm in measure one is: eighth note, sixteenth note, sixteenth note with a tie to eighth note, sixteenth note and sixteenth note. The pitches are: G 4, A 4, B 4 tied to B 4, A 4 and G 4. The rhythm in measure two is: half note. The pitch is F sharp 4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
